generic: Japanese Encephalitis Virus Vaccine, Inactivated Adsorbed
drugs: Japanese Encephalitis Virus Vaccine, Inactivated Adsorbed

0.title: Generic Names
0.mono: Japanese Encephalitis Virus Vaccine, Inactivated Adsorbed

0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Japanese encephalitis virus disease; Prophylaxis: primary series, 0.5 mL IM for 2 doses, 28 days apart; series should be completed at least 1 week prior to potential exposure
  • Japanese encephalitis virus disease; Prophylaxis: booster dose, 0.5 mL IM may be given if ongoing exposure or reexposure is expected and the primary series of 2 doses was given more than 1 year previously

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• safety and effectiveness not established in infants younger than 2 months
  • safety and effectiveness of a booster dose not established in pediatric patients younger than 17 years
  • Japanese encephalitis virus disease; Prophylaxis: (aged 2 months to less than 3 years) primary series, 0.25 mL IM for 2 doses, 28 days apart; series should be completed 1 week prior to potential exposure
  • Japanese encephalitis virus disease; Prophylaxis: (3 years or older) primary series, 0.5 mL IM for 2 doses, 28 days apart; series should be completed 1 week prior to potential exposure
  • Japanese encephalitis virus disease; Prophylaxis: (17 years or older) booster dose, 0.5 mL IM may be given if ongoing exposure or reexposure is expected and the primary series of 2 doses was given more than 1 year previously

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: severe allergic reaction (eg, anaphylaxis) to a previous dose of the vaccine, any other Japanese encephalitis virus vaccine, or any component of the product, including protamine sulfate

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• contains protamine sulfate; risk of hypersensitivity
  • immunocompromised patients; diminished immune response may occur

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Dermatologic:Erythema at injection site (adults, 9.6%; pediatrics: 2 months to less than 1 year old, 5.3% to 17.6%; 1 to less than 3 years old, 2.5% to 6.1%; 3 to less than 18 years old, up to 5.5%), Injection site irritation, Tenderness (adults, 35.9%; pediatrics: 2 months to less than 1 year old, 0.8% to 3.1%; 1 to less than 3 years old, 1.4% to 3.1%; 3 to less than 18 years old, up to 30.9%), Injection site pain (adults, 33%; pediatrics: 1 to less than 3 years old, 3.6%; 3 to less than 18 years old, up to 18.2%), Injection site reaction (adults, 55.4%)
  • Gastrointestinal:Diarrhea (pediatrics: 2 months to less than 1 year old, 8.4% to 11.5%; 1 to less than 3 years old, 4.6% to 7%; 3 to less than 18 years old, up to 1.8%), Nausea (adults, 6.6%; pediatrics, up to 2.2%)
  • Musculoskeletal:Myalgia (adults, 15.6%; pediatrics, 0.3% to 27.3%)
  • Neurologic:Headache (adults, 27.9%; pediatrics, 1.4% to 4.6%), Irritability (pediatrics: 2 months to less than 1 year old, 8.4% to 15.3%; 1 to less than 3 years old, 2.7% to 7.7%; 3 to less than 18 years old, up to 6.1%)
  • Other:Fatigue (adults, 11.3%; pediatrics, up to 12.7%), Fever (adults, 3.2%; pediatrics: 2 months to less than 1 year old, 14.5% to 23.7%; 1 to less than 3 years old, 12.7% to 20.2%; 3 to less than 18 years old, 2% to 10.7%), Influenza-like illness (adults, 12.3%; pediatrics, up to 7.7%)
Serious
Hematologic:Rectal hemorrhage

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Japanese Encephalitis Vaccine, Inactivated, Adsorbed induces antibodies that neutralize live Japanese encephalitis virus, a mosquito-borne virus, which causes Japanese encephalitis disease.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    (Ixiaro(R)) is for IM use only; do not administer IV, intradermally, or subQ
  • Intramuscular
    • shake syringe well prior to administration to obtain white, opaque, homogenous suspension
    • do not mix with any other vaccine in the same syringe or vial; use separate injection sites for concomitant administration of other vaccines
    • gently twist syringe tip to remove; do not snap or pull the tip
    • (0.5 mL dose; 3 years or older) attach sterile needle for administration
    • (0.25 mL dose; 2 months to less than 3 years of age) attach sterile safety needle; with syringe in the upright position and needle uncapped, depress plunger to red line to expel extra volume into medical waste container; replace safety needle with new sterile needle for administration.
    • (aged 2 to 11 months) inject into the anterolateral aspect of the thigh
    • (1 to less than 3 years of age) inject into the anterolateral aspect of the thigh or in the deltoid if muscle mass is adequate
    • (aged 3 years or older) inject into the deltoid muscle

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• antibody titers may be indicative of efficacy
  • allergy evaluation in patients with history of severe allergic reactions to other Japanese encephalitis vaccine
  • severe hypersensitivity reactions, including signs and symptoms of anaphylaxis

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Tell patient or caregiver to wait at least 7 days following completion of immunization schedule before traveling to foreign countries.
  • This drug may cause injection site reactions, headache, myalgia, fatigue, nausea, and fever.
  • Instruct patient or caregiver to immediately report signs of serious adverse reactions including anaphylaxis (ie, difficulty breathing, wheezing, weakness, rapid heartbeat, or hives).
  • Advise patient or caregiver of the importance of completing the immunization series.
